answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some links which may help answer your question regarding municipal music licensing.
The link below is a PDF from the ASCAP website detailing the municipal license and why they recommend purchasing it.
http://www.ascap.com/licensing/pdfs/IMLAbrochure.pdf
You can also view a full list of events when licensing music is required.
http://www.ascap.com/licensing/general/types.aspx
It seems the license agreement they are promoting is one recently developed by the International Municipal Lawyers Association, Broadcast Music Incorporated, and American Society of Composers Authors and Publishers to be a blanket license for all forms of music a municipality might need. You can see more information about that on the IMLA website below.
http://www.imla.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=74&Itemid=159
I also found some general information about how other states are handling the license on the municipal association pages of South Carolina and Massachusetts.
S.C.: http://www.masc.sc/newsroom/uptown/June2011/Pages/Musical-note-on-copyrights.aspx
Mass.: http://www.mma.org/got-a-question-try-ask-the-mma-quick-links-287/3582-does-every-performance-of-copyrighted-music-in-a-municipality-require-a-license\
I hope these help.
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Pamela Muse
text:
The City of Connell has received correspondence and several phone messages from the American Society of Composers, Authors, and Publishers (ASCAP) encouraging us to sign onto their License Agreement for Local Government Entities relating to the playing of music at events and functions or within municipal facilities including the tunes being played on the city phone system while citizens are on hold.
We are looking for specific criteria for a city to follow to determine the cases where the annual license is necessary for its organization? Or is this pretty much mandatory for cities to keep themselves from being challenged by ASCAP?
Your input is appreciated.
Steve Taylor, City Administrator
City of Connell, WA
stevetaylor98@gmail.com
title: License Agreement - Music at Public Events - ASCAP
